message: Now that the white king is split, try to capture the black king.
(You'll have to choose one of the splits).
If the white king was where you selected then the black king was captured.
If you weren't so lucky and the white king was in the other square, then the capture wasn't performed.
Whatever happened the white king is collapsed and you can click the collapse button to check it.
To summarize, when you try to capture a piece your piece will be collapsed first to see if the capture is valid.
Note that capturing doesn't collapse the piece that's being captured, only your own.

initial_message: The Double Occupancy rule is also used when trying to capture with a piece that is in superposition.
To see how it works, split the white king to the left and downwards.
